Key Arguments: The bill grants unnecessary reserve powers to ACMA, as the voluntary code is already effective.
The bill will restrict free speech, which is a fundamental pillar of democracy.
The bill exempts government and media, which is unfair as free speech should apply to all.
There is a lack of trust in any organization to accurately determine what is harmful or factual.
The bill represents a power grab, potentially exploiting the chaos from the COVID-19 pandemic.
The submitter opposes any organization determining what individuals can read, see, or think.
Main Themes: Concerns about overreach and power grabs
Skepticism about the ability to define harm and facts
Notable Quotes: The timing of this bill seems to indicate it is taking advantage of the covid chaos to make a power grab.
Free speech is one of the pillars of democracy. It seems the purpose of this bill is to use democracy to take away democracy.
I do not trust any organization (government or otherwise) to accurately or disinterestedly determine what is and what is not 'harmful.'
